snippet: Much of Japan’s post-Fukushima cleanup is primitive, slapdash and bereft of the cleanup methods lauded by scientists as effective in removing radioactive cesium.
abstract: Much of Japan’s post-Fukushima Daiichi nuclear power plant cleanup is being denounced as primitive, slapdash and bereft of cleanup methods lauded by scientists as effective in removing radioactive cesium; reports of crews dumping contaminated soil into rivers have focused attention on sloppiness of cleanup.

byline.contributor: Makiko Inoue contributed reporting from Tokyo.

lead_paragraph: Much of Japan’s post-Fukushima cleanup is primitive, slapdash and bereft of the cleanup methods lauded by scientists as effective in removing radioactive cesium.

headline.seo: Japan’s Cleanup After a Nuclear Accident Is Denounced
headline.main: In Japan, a Painfully Slow Sweep
